sub_topic: The construction of the Heighway dragon curve.
message_1: What is the perimeter of the 10th iteration of the Heighway dragon curve if the initial line segment has a length of 1 unit?
message_2:
The perimeter of the Heighway dragon curve can be calculated using the formula:

Perimeter = Initial line segment length × (2^(n/2))

where n is the number of iterations.

For the 10th iteration, the formula becomes:

Perimeter = 1 × (2^(10/2))

Perimeter = 1 × (2^5)

Perimeter = 1 × 32

Perimeter = 32 units
